    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    AdderFactory
    This class demonstrates a closure that sums two numbers together.
    AgeInDays
    This class calculates a person's age in days.
    Antistring
    This class manipulates a string in such a way that its characters are replaced and the string itself is reversed.
    APlusB
    This class sums two bytes together and returns a byte.
    Arbitrage
    This program creates one or more currency exchange tables and finds the exchange sequence that results in the highest profit for each currency exchange table.
    AreaOrPerimeter
    This class calculates the area or perimeter depending on whether the sides are equal.
    AreYouPlayingBanjo
    This class returns a message depending on the first letter of a person's name.
    ArrayPlusArray
    This class sums two integer arrays together using the Java 8 Stream API.
    AverageGradeByDept
    This class groups the average grade by department using the Java 8 stream API.
    BifidCipher
    This class uses the Bifid Cipher to either encode or decode a message.
    Blocks
     
    BowlingScoreCalculator
    A front-end for the Bowling kata.
    CaffeineScript
    This class returns a string based on some characteristics of an integer.
    CenterOfTheMatrix
    This class finds the integer that is at the center of a matrix.
    ChangingLetters
    This class converts all vowels in a string to uppercase letters.
    CheckThreeAndTwo
    This class returns true if an array of characters contains three of one character and two of another character.
    ClockPatience
    This class creates a card game in which the computer takes a card from the top of a pile, flips it over, and then puts it under another pile.
    Collatz
    This class calculates a collatz sequence by repeatedly applying the following formula to a positive integer until the result is equal to 1: if the number is even, then divide it by 2; if the number is odd, then multiply the number by 3 and then add 1.
    CollatzConjectureLength
    This class calculates a collatz sequence by repeatedly applying the following formula to a positive integer until the result is equal to 1: if the number is even, then divide it by 2; if the number is odd, then multiply the number by 3 and then add 1.
    ColorGhost
    This class returns the name of a random color for a ghost.
    CompareWithinMargin
    This class compares two doubles and returns whether one is lower than, close to, or higher than the other.
    ConferenceTraveller
    This class returns the name of the city that the conference traveller should visit if she has never visited it before.
    ConsecutivePrimesCalculator
    The user interface for the Sum of Consecutive Prime Numbers kata.
    ConvertTimeToString
    This class converts seconds to days, hours, minutes, and seconds.
    CorrectTimeString
    This class corrects a timestamp by performing addition to the number of seconds, minutes, and hours.
    Counter<T>
    This class is equivalent to the Counter class found in Python.
    CountSheep
    This class generates a string that someone would say when trying to sleep, that is, counting sheep.
    CountTheMonkeys
    This class returns an array of numbers representing the number of monkeys that a child has counted.
    Covfefe
    This class replaces all instnaces of the word "coverage" with "covfefe".
    CurrencyExchange
    This class is used by the Arbitrage class to store a currency exchange sequence and the profit one makes by using it.
    CycleLength
     
    DaysBetween
    This class counts the number of days between two dates.
    DecimalDecomposition
    This class decomposes a number into a string that represents the sum of each digit's value.
    DecipherTheMessage
    This class decodes a string that was encoded using a Caesar Cipher with an alphabetic shift of seven.
    DifferenceBetweenYearsLevel1
    This class calculates the difference in years between two dates.
    DigitPrimes
    Finds the number of digit primes between two numbers, inclusive.
    DoubleSort
    This class sorts an array of objects that may contain only numbers, only strings, or a combination of both.
    DragonsCurve
    This class demonstrates the use of Java 8 lambda functions to create a dragon's curve, which is a fractal in mathematics.
    ExecuteMe
    This class executes a Runnable object in separate threads.
    Fibonacci
    This class contains a method called Fibonacci.fib(int) that will return the n-th Fibonacci number without using any data structures.
    FindMaximumAndMinimumValues
    This class returns the minimum and maximum values in an array of numbers.
    FindNumbersThatAreDivisible
    This class finds all the numbers in an array that are divisible by a given number.
    FirstNonRepeatedCharacter
    This class returns the first character that is not repeated (i.e.
    FollowingOrders
    Given N letters and a list of constraints, a list of strings that satisfy all of the constraints will be returned.
    FourSeven
    This class returns a number without using any if statements, switch statements, or ternary operators.
    FunctionalProgramming
    This class demonstrates the use of the Function class, which was introduced in Java 8.
    GathererImpl
    This class demonstrates a new preview feature in Java 22 called a stream gatherer.
    HammingCode
    This class encodes and decodes text using the Hamming Code.
    HidePasswordFromJdbcUrl
    This class masks out a password if it is found in a JDBC connection string.
    HistoryGrading
    Contains methods that will read in students' responses and grade them.
    HoursToSeconds
    This class converts hours to seconds using the LocalDateTime and Duration classes.
    HQ9Plus
    This class implements a simple interpreter for the esoteric language HQ9+.
    InspiringStrings
    This class returns the longest word from a space-separated list of words.
    Intersection
    This program determines whether a line intersects a rectangle by checking if a point on the line is inside the rectangle.
    KataEnums
    This enum is used especially by the KataUtils class to simplify the creation of methods that return different types of objects.
    KataException
    Represents the base class for all unchecked (runtime) exceptions that occur in a kata.
    KataUtils
    This class contains a set of methods that will help solving future Java katas much easier.
    KeyWord
    Given a file containing profiles and titles, this program determines which titles satisfy each profile.
    LargeFactorials
    This class calculates the factorial of a number without using BigInteger.
    Line
    A class representing a line for the Squares kata.
    LinearEquationSolver
    Solves linear equations with only one variable.
    LineUpStudents
    This class sorts the given space-delimited list of students first by their name length in descending order and then by alphabetical order from Z to A if two or more strings names the same length.
    LineWrapper
    This class inserts line breaks into a string so that no line is longer than a given number.
    MaximumSum
     
    MeanVsMedian
    This class returns "mean" if the mean (average) of all the numbers in an array is greater than the median (the number in the middle of the array after the array is sorted).
    MostFrequentItemCount
    This class counts each integer in an array and returns the highest count.
    MouseClick
    Processes a file containing coordinates for icons, regions, and mouse clicks, and outputs all regions that were clicked on and all icons that were nearest to a mouse click.
    MultiplesOfTwo
    This class finds all the numbers that are multiples of two numbers.
    NameArrayCapping
    This class turns all the letters of each string in an array of strings into lowercase, except for the first letter, which is turned into uppercase.
    NumStudentsByDept
    This class groups the number of students by department using the Java 8 stream API.
    NumStudentsByGenderByDept
    This class groups the number of students by gender for each department using the Java 8 stream API.
    OneTwoThreeFour
    This class provides an API that returns an enum for a number from one to four in the English, Japanese, and French languages.
    PancakeStacks
    Sorts one or more stacks of pancakes that were read in from a file from smallest to biggest.
    Permalex
    Reads in strings from a file and determines their positions in the ordered sequence of permutations of their constituent characters.
    PersistentBugger
    This class counts the number of times the digits in a number is multiplied with each other until the product contains only a single digit.
    PlayingCard
    This class is used to create a new playing card, which can be used in katas that involve playing cards.
    PokerHandStraightOrNot
    This class determines whether a given list of cards represents a straight in the game of poker.
    PositivesCountNegativesSum
    This class generates a two-element array: the first element represents the count of all the positive numbers in the input array, and the second element represents the sum of all the negative numbers in the same input array.
    PowersOfTwo
    This class generates an array that contains all the powers of two, e.g.
    PrintingArrayElements
    This class generates a comma-separated list of all the elements in an array of objects.
    RemoveDuplicates
    This class removes duplicate integers from an array while keeping the order of the elements in the array.
    ResponsibleDrinking
    This class uses the Java 8 Stream API to count the number of alcoholic drinks that were consumed.
    ReverseVowelsOfAString
    This class reverses all the vowels in a string.
    RomanRoulette
    A solution to the Josephus problem (also known as Roman Roulette).
    RunRunner
    This class is an example of how to create and start threads, and how to add integers to a collection in a thread-safe manner.
    SearchingQuickly
    This program sorts a list of titles using KWIC (Keywords In Context).
    SentenceSmash
    This class uses the Java 8 Stream API to combine all the strings in an array into one string.
    SortArrays1
    This class contains methods that return sorted arrays that are copies of the original arrays.
    SortCsvFileColumns
    This class sorts the column names in a string that represents a CSV file.
    SortMyTextbooks
    This class performs a case-insensitive sort of a list of textbook names.
    SortTheOddWay
    This class sorts an array of numbers based on whether they are even or odd.
    Spreadsheet
    Reads in a file containing one or more spreadsheets that contain formulas and outputs one or more new spreadsheets that contain the results of calculating those formulas.
    Squares
    This program reads in lines representing start or end points for horizontal or vertical lines and counts the number of squares that the lines form.
    StaticElectrickery
    This class provides a working method that adds one hundred to a number.
    StringRepeat
    This class repeats a string one or more times.
    StringTask
    This class removes characters from a string, inserts characters into the same string, and converts the remaining characters in the string.
    StringyStrings
    This class returns a string of alternating ones and zeroes.
    Student
    This class represents a student with a first name, last name, and ID number.
    Student
    This record represents a student with a name, his or her final grade, the department to which he or she belongs, and his or her gender.
    Student.Gender
    The gender of a student, either male or female.
    StudentNamesByDept
    This class groups student names by department using the Java 8 stream API.
    SurrealCheck
    This class determines if two lists of integers fit the definition of a surreal number in terms of a form.
    TwoSum
    This class finds two integers in an array that sum to a target value.
    Unixls
    Prints a list of filenames to a table in sorted alphabetical order to the screen.
    WolfInSheepsClothing
    This class displays a message depending on the location of a wolf in an array of strings representing sheep.
    WordCrosses
    This program will form double leading crosses if common letters are found in each pair of vertical and horizontal words.
    WorldBitsWar
    This class counts the total number of bits that are turned on in a group of even numbers and a group of odd numbers.
    Yacg2
    This class determines who the winner is after one trick (or round) in a game of cards.
